departments.name: Department of Egyptian Antiquities of the Louvre

exhibits.title: The Seated Scribe
exhibits.description: The sculpture of the Seated Scribe or Squatting Scribe is a famous work of ancient Egyptian art. It represents a figure of a seated scribe at work. The sculpture was discovered at Saqqara, north of the alley of sphinxes leading to the Serapeum of Saqqara, in 1850 and dated to the period of the Old Kingdom, from either the 5th Dynasty, c. 2450–2325 BCE or the 4th Dynasty, 2620–2500 BCE. It is now in the Louvre Museum in Paris.

exhibits.title: Sobieski at Vienna
exhibits.description: Sobieski's greatest success came in 1683, with his victory at the Battle of Vienna, in joint command of Polish and German troops, against the invading Ottoman Turks under Kara Mustafa.

exhibits.title: Reconstruction of the Nereid Monument
exhibits.description: The monument was probably built for Erbinna (known as Arbinas in Greek), ruler of Lycian Xanthos in modern-day south-west Turkey. Although he wasn't Greek, Erbinna chose to be buried in a tomb that mostly resembled a Greek temple of the Ionic order, but here placed on a high podium following the local tradition for burials of important individuals.

exhibits.title: Ewer (Brocca)
exhibits.description: Porcelains imported from China were avidly acquired by royal and aristocratic collectors, and the Florentine workshop were the first to attempt production of this highly valued material in Europe.

exhibits.title: The Birth of Venus
exhibits.description: The Birth of Venus is a painting by the Italian artist Sandro Botticelli, probably made in the mid 1480s. It depicts the goddess Venus arriving at the shore after her birth, when she had emerged from the sea fully-grown.

exhibits.title: Thutmosis III statue
exhibits.description: Thutmose III was the sixth pharaoh of the Eighteenth Dynasty. Officially, Thutmose III ruled Egypt for almost 54 years and his reign is usually dated from 28 April 1479 BC to 11 March 1425 BC, from the age of two and until his death at age fifty-six; however, during the first 22 years of his reign, he was coregent with his stepmother and aunt, Hatshepsut, who was named the pharaoh.

exhibits.title: The Clothed Maja
exhibits.description: The Clothed Maja is a pendant painting by the Spanish painter Francisco de Goya between 1800 and 1805. It is a clothed version of the earlier La maja desnuda (1797–1800) and is exhibited next to it in the same room at the Prado Museum in Madrid.

exhibits.title: Snorkel at the gallery
exhibits.description: This tour is as fun as it is educational for children and adults. Children can identify many species of fish and marine life, they can also learn the importance of protecting the reef areas. This tour begins with a boat ride through the Nichupté lagoon, the mangroves and finally the ocean, where you will be prepared for the tour in this gallery on a snorkeling platform.

exhibits.title: Mały Powstaniec
exhibits.description: Mały Powstaniec is a statue in commemoration of the child soldiers who fought and died during the Warsaw Uprising of 1944. It is located on Podwale Street, Warsaw, Poland, next to the ramparts of Warsaw's Old Town.

exhibits.title: Knuffingen Airport
exhibits.description: Knuffingen airport was officially opened to visitors on May 4, 2011 as a special section of the facility. Its buildings resemble Hamburg Airport. As in the fictional main town of Knuffingen, there is also a simulation of a fire department with a large fleet of vehicles, including four airfield fire engines.
